name: covid
about_s: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus. Most people who fall sick with COVID-19 will experience mild to moderate symptoms and recover without special treatment.

name: aids
about_s: HIV stands for human immunodeficiency virus. It weakens a personâ€™s immune system by destroying important cells that fight disease and infection. There is currently no effective cure for HIV.

name: commoncold
about_s: Common cold can be caused by many different types of viruses. The condition is generally harmless and symptoms usually resolve within two weeks.

name: hepatitisa
about_s: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious, short-term liver infection caused by the Hepatitis A virus.

name: hepatitisb
about_s: Hepatitis B is a vaccine-preventable liver infection caused by the Hepatitis B virus.

name: rabies
about_s: Rabies is a preventable viral disease most often transmitted through the bite of a rabid animal. The rabies virus infects the central nervous system of mammals, ultimately causing disease in the brain and death.

name: h1n1
about_s: Swine flu, also known as the H1N1 virus, is a relatively new strain of an influenza virus that causes symptoms similar to the regular flu.
